keyword: how many calories in a half cup of blueberries
title: How Many Calories in a Half Cup of Blueberries?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a half cup of blueberries, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, fat, and quick tweaks for your diet.
h1: How Many Calories in a Half Cup of Blueberries?
assumptions: Fresh, whole blueberries; approximately 74 g per half cup; no added sugar or processing.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by variety, ripeness, freshness, and measurement; check labels for packaged products.

quick_answer.text: A half cup of fresh blueberries provides about 42 kcal and 2 grams of fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a half cup of blueberries?
faqs.a: About 42 kcal for a half cup of fresh blueberries.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in half a cup of blueberries?
faqs.a: Approximately 10.7 g carbs, including 1.8 g fiber and 7.4 g sugars.

faqs.q: Are blueberries low in fat and protein?
faqs.a: Yes, only 0.2 g fat and 0.5 g protein per half cup.

faqs.q: How does frozen vs fresh blueberries compare in calories?
faqs.a: Similar calories if no sugar added; frozen may retain more nutrients.

faqs.q: Do blueberries have cholesterol or sodium?
faqs.a: Negligibleâ€”0 mg cholesterol and just 1 mg sodium per half cup.
